meeting_context:
# North Star & Strategic Context

This file combines the overall project mission (North Star) and summaries of key strategic documents for use in AI prompts, particularly for the AI Agent Council context generation.

---

**North Star:**
To build a truly autonomous, sustainable DAO that develops open-source software accelerating the path toward AGI, blending AI researchers, open-source hackers, and crypto degens to create AI agents streaming, shitposting, and trading 24/7 on auto.fun to attract users and bootstrap an autonomous organization.

---

**ElizaOS Mission Summary (`docs/blog/mission.mdx`):**
The elizaOS mission is to build an extensible, modular, open-source AI agent framework for Web2/Web3, seeing agents as steps toward AGI. Core values are Autonomy, Modularity, and Decentralization. Key products include the framework itself, DegenSpartanAI (trading agent), Autonomous Investor/Trust Marketplace (social trading intelligence), and the Agent Marketplace/auto.fun (launchpad).

---

**ElizaOS Reintroduction Summary (`docs/blog/reintroduction.mdx`):**
elizaOS is an open-source "operating system for AI agents" aimed at decentralizing AI development away from corporate control. It's built on three pillars: 1) The Eliza Framework (TypeScript toolkit for persistent, interoperable agents), 2) AI-Enhanced Governance (building autonomous DAOs), and 3) Eliza Labs (R&D for future capabilities like v2, Trust Marketplace, auto.fun, DegenSpartanAI, Eliza Studios). The native Solana token coordinates the ecosystem and captures value. The vision is an intelligent internet built on open protocols and collaboration.

---

**Auto.fun Introduction Summary (`docs/blog/autofun-intro.mdx`):**
Auto.fun is an AI-native, creator-first token launchpad designed for sustainable AI/crypto projects. It aims to balance fair community access with project funding needs through mechanisms like bonding curves and liquidity NFTs. Key features include a no-code agent builder, AI-generated marketing tools, and integration with the elizaOS ecosystem. It serves as a core product driving value back to the native token ($ai16z) through buybacks and liquidity pairing.

---

**Taming Information Summary (`docs/blog/taming_info.mdx`):**
Addresses the challenge of information scattered across platforms (Discord, GitHub, X). Proposes using AI agents as "bridges" to collect, wrangle (summarize/tag), and distribute information in various formats (JSON, MD, RSS, dashboards, 3D shows). Showcases an AI News system and AI Assistants for tech support as examples. Emphasizes treating documentation as a first-class citizen to empower AI assistants and streamline community operations.
monthly_goal: Current focus: Stabilize and attract new users to auto.fun by showcasing 24/7 agent activity (streaming, trading, shitposting), ship production ready elizaOS v2.
daily_focus: Token migration from AI16Z to ELIZAOS is progressing with exchanges pending full implementation, while strategic development of the streaming network concept advances to support the auto.fun ecosystem.

key_points.summary: The migration from AI16Z to ELIZAOS tokens is underway with a 1:6 ratio, but several exchanges are still pending implementation, causing temporary trading suspensions and community uncertainty.

deliberation_items.text: How should we prioritize exchange outreach to accelerate the migration process?
context: Team needs to send new ELIZAOS tokens to exchanges like Gate.io and KuCoin to complete migration for users (mentioned by bct)
Some exchanges (Gate.io, KuCoin) have suspended AI16Z withdrawals and trading while awaiting new tokens

answer_1.text: Prioritize high-volume exchanges with immediate outreach and dedicated support teams.
answer_1.implication: Targeting high-volume exchanges first would maximize migration impact but might leave smaller exchanges' users feeling neglected.

answer_2.text: Implement a parallel approach with simultaneous outreach to all remaining exchanges.
answer_2.implication: A parallel approach distributes resources evenly but may slow down overall migration completion if resources are stretched thin.

answer_3.text: Focus on creating automated tooling for exchanges to self-serve migration needs.
answer_3.implication: Self-serve tooling could scale effectively but would delay immediate migration completion while the tools are developed.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What communication strategy should we adopt to address user concerns during the migration period?
context: Create clear timeline for exchange migrations and communicate it to users (mentioned by kudin28)
Compile statistics on AI16z token migration percentages, possibly via Dune Analytics (mentioned by MicoM.ron)

answer_1.text: Daily updates with migration progress statistics and exchange-specific timelines.
answer_1.implication: Frequent detailed updates would enhance transparency but create expectation of continuous communication that might be difficult to maintain.

answer_2.text: Centralized dashboard showing real-time migration statistics with exchange status indicators.
answer_2.implication: A real-time dashboard would reduce manual update needs but requires technical resources to develop and maintain.

answer_3.text: Weekly official summaries with targeted responses to high-visibility community questions.
answer_3.implication: Weekly structured communication conserves team resources but might feel insufficient to users experiencing migration issues.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we leverage the migration period to reinforce the ELIZAOS utility narrative?
context: Q: Is this token still considered a meme coin? A: No, it is AI utility. Also benefiting from memes momentum through old coin (AI16Z) (answered by Omid sa)
The ELIZAOS token is mintable to support multichain functionality

answer_1.text: Release a comprehensive utility whitepaper highlighting multichain functionality and platform integration.
answer_1.implication: A detailed technical whitepaper would establish credibility but might not capture attention of non-technical token holders.

answer_2.text: Create visual explainers and short videos demonstrating real-world ELIZAOS token utility in auto.fun ecosystem.
answer_2.implication: Visual content would engage broader audience but requires significant creative resources to produce effectively.

answer_3.text: Launch limited utility demonstrations requiring ELIZAOS tokens during the migration period.
answer_3.implication: Live utility demonstrations would provide tangible proof of value but risk technical issues if rushed during migration.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: A strategic vision is emerging for an umbrella streaming network concept that would house multiple shows, including Clank Tank, to create cohesive content distribution for auto.fun ecosystem engagement.

deliberation_items.text: How should we structure the umbrella brand for maximum ecosystem impact?
context: Discussion about creating a streaming network concept that would house multiple shows including "Clank Tank"
Jin clarified to users that rather than having separate accounts per show, they're considering an umbrella brand to house multiple shows

answer_1.text: Build a cohesive network brand with standardized visual identity across all shows and channels.
answer_1.implication: A unified brand approach creates stronger recognition but limits creative flexibility for individual shows.

answer_2.text: Create a loose federation of related but visually distinct shows with subtle network branding.
answer_2.implication: A federation approach allows show-specific identity while making network growth more challenging to communicate.

answer_3.text: Implement a hybrid model with strong network identity for infrastructure while allowing show-level creative freedom.
answer_3.implication: A hybrid approach balances cohesion and creativity but requires more complex brand management.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What interactive features should we prioritize for the streaming network to drive engagement?
context: Ideas to repurpose "$ai16z retire code" for interactive features in streams
Repurpose "$ai16z retire code" for interactive stream features allowing users to "retire" coins triggering audio/visual effects (mentioned by DorianD)

answer_1.text: Token-activated visual and audio effects that viewers can trigger during streams.
answer_1.implication: Token-activated effects create immediate utility but risk distracting from core content if overused.

answer_2.text: Governance voting mechanisms allowing token holders to influence show topics and content direction.
answer_2.implication: Governance features strengthen community ownership but slow down content production with decision processes.

answer_3.text: Exclusive token-gated content areas with deeper engagement opportunities for ELIZAOS holders.
answer_3.implication: Token-gated exclusivity increases perceived value but risks limiting audience growth potential.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: GitHub activity shows focused development on core framework features including entity-level security, dynamic prompt execution, and React integration, aligning with the goal of shipping production-ready elizaOS v2.

deliberation_items.text: Which technical development should receive highest resource allocation to support auto.fun adoption?
context: Current focus: Stabilize and attract new users to auto.fun by showcasing 24/7 agent activity (streaming, trading, shitposting), ship production ready elizaOS v2.
feat: implement entity-level row level security (PR #6107)
feat: Framework for adjusting prompts to best fix model contexts (PR #6113)
feat: create @elizaos/react package with headless React hooks (PR #6093)

answer_1.text: Prioritize the React hooks package to enable external developers to build custom interfaces.
answer_1.implication: Focusing on the React package would accelerate third-party adoption but delays improvements to core agent capabilities.

answer_2.text: Accelerate the dynamic prompt execution framework to enhance agent reliability across different models.
answer_2.implication: Prioritizing prompt execution would improve agent reliability but delays developer experience improvements.

answer_3.text: Focus on the entity-level security implementation to support enterprise-grade applications.
answer_3.implication: Emphasizing security features attracts institutional adoption but may slow immediate consumer-facing feature development.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.
